text:
Las Vegas witnesses significant tourist growth potential from Latin American countries Published on : Tuesday, September 15, 2015
Las Vegas tourism is booming, thanks to the Latin American push. Las Vegas has witnessed a rise in Latin American tourists in the recent past with visitors from Mexico blazing the trail.
Visitors from Mexico to Las Vegas are at the top of the list, with more than 1.3 million tourists flocking to the city in 2014, a 19 percent increase from the prior year followed by Brazilians and tourists from other countries like Chile and Colombia.
Brazilian tourism in Las Vegas grew by 13 percent in 2014, with more than 220,000 visitors from that country, according to Rafael Villanueva, the director of international sales for the Las Vegas Convention and Visitors Authority, or LVCVA.
By the same token, the LVCVA expects there to be significant tourist growth potential among Argentines, more than 30,000 of whom arrived last year.
With this Latin American push, Las Vegas this week is commemorating – for the sixth time – the traditional 1810 call for Mexican independence at a trade center built from enormous cargo containers and known as the Downtown Container Park.
Las Vegas is encouraging visitors to enjoy the great variety of experiences offered on Mexican Independence Day, according to the public invitation by Cathy Tull, the LVCVA’s vice president for marketing.
The traditional festivities surrounding Mexican Independence Day in Las Vegas this week have already become a “celebration of independence days of other countries of the region, Villanueva told EFE on Monday.
Performing at the celebration are Mexican’s Luis Miguel, Juan Gabriel, Alejandro Fernandez, Marco Antonio Solis, Pepe Aguilar and Alejandra Guzman in various hotels, and now they are being joined by well-known Spanish and Latin American artists.
In the coming days, Spaniards Enrique Iglesias and Placido Domingo, Puerto Ricans Ricky Martin and Chayanne, New York salsa singer Marc Anthony, Colombia’s Carlos Vives and Guatemala’s Ricardo Arjona will all take the stage in “casino city.”
